text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly addresses the concept of shared responsibility and liability under the Regulatory Reform (Fire Safety) Order 2005 (FSO). It discusses how liability depends on the extent of control and cooperation, noting that as the building owner, the client retains ultimate responsibility even in a shared space, which directly relates to the duties under Articles 5(3) (cooperation between dutyholders) and 22 (general duties of the responsible person) of the FSO 2005. The analysis contrasts the duties of the building owner (the client) against the duties of the neighboring company, which is the core concept tested by this criterion.", "criterion_id": "5a7e0773-5baa-4db9-ad30-8b52ad1d1305"}
